post.title: Porn on Your Computer
post.body:
By having **GIF Time** (data\1Gif7PqWTzVWDQ42Mo7np3zXmGAo3DXc7h) on your **ZeroNet Hello** even though you don't activate it, you will have porn videos and pictures downloaded to your ZeroNet folder by default.

_Search_ your **ZeroNet folder** for .mp4 and you'll find them.

post.title: Mirroring a website to work without internet on ZeroNet
post.body:
A frustration with **wget** so far has been that the websites such as [Celsius](http://127.0.0.1:43110/celsius.bit/) and [Vista](http://127.0.0.1:43110/vista.bit/) have still needed an internet connection to their servers to work properly. So I tried this: 

''-k

--convert-links
After the download is complete, convert the links in the document to make them suitable for local viewing. This affects not only the visible hyperlinks, but any part of the document that links to external content, such as embedded images, links to style sheets, hyperlinks to non-HTML content, etc.'' (http://linuxreviews.org/man/wget/)

And used this at Ubuntu's _terminal emulator_, using Mozilla's Firefox as my browser:

**wget --wait=20 --limit-rate=20K -r -p -U Mozilla http://automatetheboringstuff.com/ -nH --random-wait -nc -k**

To get [Automatetheboringstuff](http://127.0.0.1:43110/automatetheboringstuff.bit/) to work with a [ZeroNet non-working proxy](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:21:Protect+yourself+with+a+non-working+proxy). 

Make sure to **New Folder** and **wget** in that directory or you will get files all over.

post.title: WebTorrent Desktop and Archive.org Torrent files
post.body:
[Kopy Kate](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1aCq7GiJfUfGZ4GftjYaYbsEngPFzcxvN/) has a video upload zite that we can cloned. 

I've been playing with a clone here at [Dipbeak](http://127.0.0.1:43110/dipbeak.bit/). 

A clever thing to do might be to use **WebTorrent Desktop** to ~~**File>Open Torrent Address...** and use an address for a torrent on [Archive.org](http://127.0.0.1:43110/vista.bit/)~~. But this causes the _torrent_ to not play properly but only preview as [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/dipbeak.bit/?Topic:11_12rMePjZCdJVqTaAYf3Dg3fk3bYFfTPDsP/Charlie+Chaplin+s+The+Vagabond) (hover over the _torrent info:_ magnet to see where it is coming from). 

Using WebTorrent Desktop on a file that is still downloading also causes an error:( as the torrent address has the % downloaded as part of its url.

I've tried ~~.VOB~~ and ~~.AVI~~ files and only MP4 has worked so far. 

And if the computer's processor is busy and a video played, _WebTorrent Desktop_ skips the _automatic play on start_ and the screen has to be refreshed.

post.title: 1 FILE UPDATE FAILED
post.body:
You may see on your [ZeroHello](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/) page **'1 FILE UPDATE FAILED'**. 

To remedy this, go to the (0) top-right of the zite that is failing. Pull the (0) all the way to the left. Scroll down to **'SITE CONTROL'**,  click the **'Update'** button. You'll see the actual file that is failing to update disappear. 

More information about this is found here, under ['siteUpdate'](http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#siteupdate-address).

post.title: I've digressed...
post.body:
I've digressed from my quest to find some nice games on ZeroNet. Here are two:

[Pacman](http://127.0.0.1:43110/14Q1So3DH9qvHts5VuLDgqGp7yCXceujop/)

[Flappybird](http://127.0.0.1:43110/16nsEmQ1ErcdNRpe7zmSg5eF2Y1zQpuURp/)

post.title: Getting a .bit Site Name for Your New ZeroNet Site
post.body:
[The instructions here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/eventi.bit/?Post:4:Finally+Synced+Namecoin!!!) are correct except for some clarification. 

The biggest correction we should make is that the [JSON string](http://127.0.0.1:43110/cryptonbits.bit/?Post:4:How+to+connect+your+.bit+domain+with+your+Zeronet+site) example has spaces: it shouldn't to work:

~~{ "zeronet" : { " " : "1C5P1EcTZA6FDEg4w6SacfPjvSDCWmzeyt" } }~~

The JSON string needs to have **no spaces**:

**{"zeronet":{"":"1C5P1EcTZA6FDEg4w6SacfPjvSDCWmzeyt"}}**

The second clarification is we need to see all three of these in our **Namecoin-QT** for our name to be ready to use on ZeroNet:

**name_new**:d/ 0.02NMC
**name_firstupdate**:d/ 0.00NMC
**name_update**:d/ 0.005NMC

The last one we need to initiate, and we will do when we write our _JSON string_. The first two will happen when we pick a name and pay NMC for it. 

And third, [we need to add](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1QLLPpowM6BWxKYKops1WkCafuFPhFBnAx/?Post:3:Using+.bit+domains) **"domain":"mynewwebsitename.bit",** to the **content.json** in the folder of our website for ZeroNet to see it.

post.title: siteSign-ing Cloned ZeroNet sites
post.body:
As we don't have the _private key_ for a cloned zite all we have to do is pull the (0) top-right until it holds. Scroll down and toggle the **'This is my site'**. And then click **Sign** and **Publish** at the bottom. 

This works for cloned sites but doesn't seem to work for **siteCreate**d sites we own.

post.title: CONTENT.JSON DOWNLOAD FAILED
post.body:
Don't forget to sign your new ZeroNet site! 

On windows in _command prompt_($, don't write this symbol)  navigate to your **ZeronetBundle-win**>**ZeroBundle**> and if you are to sign site **1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS**:

_Windows_: 

$ **zeronet.cmd siteSign 1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS** 

And then copy and paste the **private key** you got when you **siteCreate**d the zite. 

In _Ubuntu_ (Linux) navigate in _terminal emulator_ to **ZeroNet-master**:

$ **zeronet.py siteSign 1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS**

And do the same as above, but **Edit>Paste** your _private key_.

post.title: Starting your own new zite on ZeroNet in Linux (Ubuntu)
post.body:
To start your own new zite in Linux (Ubuntu) you will need to again [navigate](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:23:Installing+ZeroNet+on+Linux:+a+how+to) to your **ZeroNet-master** folder and then type at the terminal ($ means the terminal prompt, you don't need to type it yourself):

$ **./zeronet.py siteCreate**

Then follow the normal [instructions](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:17:Publishing+Your+Own+ZeroNet+Website) below. 

Do note that trying to Ctrl-c your **private key** in _terminal_ is fiddly and it may be best you just highlight the text you need and click **Edit>Copy**. 

The great thing now is that we can **wget** in Linux and have the folders right there for ZeroNet. The challenge now is to _wget_ an actual copy of a website that works with a [ZeroNet non-working proxy](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:21:Protect+yourself+with+a+non-working+proxy). 

By the way, there isn't [$2 in the Bitcoin](http://127.0.0.1:43110/cryptonbits.bit/?Post:5:Your+Zeronet+Site+is+a+Bitcoin+Wallet) _private key_ you get when you start a new zite anymore: I looked:( 

Also, I've tried every which way with [getting a Namecoin](http://127.0.0.1:43110/cryptonbits.bit/?Post:4:How+to+connect+your+.bit+domain+with+your+Zeronet+site) .bit address, to no avail. It's easier [renaming your zite](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:22:Change+the+Name+of+Sites+to+Recognise+them) this way.

post.title: Installing ZeroNet on Linux: a how to
post.body:
[I've had much trouble](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:14:GitHub+ZeroNet+Linux+installation+instructions) trying to get ZeroNet on Linux although I've seen postings (such as **joczo11**'s below) and youtube videos of how supposedly easy it is. So I decided to take our [esteemed colleague's good advice](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:14:GitHub+ZeroNet+Linux+installation+instructions#Comments) and went to [Github](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet) where top-right I selected the green 'Clone or Download' then 'Download ZIP file'. Once that was done Ubuntu (the Linux version I was working in) asked me whether and where I wanted to extract, which I did where it said.

The problems I had before with both Ubuntu and another version of Debian is that the **gevent** and **msgpack** files are missing. Ubuntu has support for these files as webwurst points out:

_"It seems the package python-msgpack-python exists on OpenSUSE. Ubuntu Precise provides msgpack-python and since Ubuntu Trusty we have python-msgpack."_(https://github.com/ceph/calamari/issues/249)

The easiest way I have found - as a newbie - to get these files is use **Synaptic**. So you'll need to go to _Software_ and search 'Synaptic' which you then install. Once you click on **Synaptic** and enter your password you can then search for **'msgpack'** and **'gevent'** and tick their boxes. Ubuntu will also ask you to install another with a name like 'greenlet', say _yes_ to that. Then click 'Apply' and the installation will begin.  

Now you need to open **Terminal** the same way you opened _Synaptic_, it will already be on your Linux. Here you will need to _navigate_ to the **ZeroNet-master** folder you extracted. You can do so by:

 **ls** 
_this will view what is in the current directory (folder) you are in_

**cd** 
_this will change the directory to what you write after it_

**cd ..**
_remember the space between the cd and the .., this takes you back to the previous directory up_

press [**TAB**]
_will complete the word you are writing so your don't have to spell it all out whether command or file name: so write **cd ZeroN** and then press TAB to get **cd ZeroNet-master**_ then press Enter.

This is a brief run through of what I wrote at the terminal (_jon@ubuntumachine:~$_ is similar to what you'll find at the terminal on your machine, you don't need to write it):

jon@ubuntumachine:~$ **cd ZeroNet-master**
jon@ubuntumachine:~$ **ls**
jon@ubuntumachine:~$ **./zeronet.py**


So what you do is navigate with the above commands in terminal until you get to the folder that if you **ls** it, you will find **zeronet.py**

To run **zeronet.py** you need to write in terminal like this ($ means the terminal, you don't write it):

$ **./zeronet.py**

Yes, with the **./** in front; and ZeroNet will run. 

ZeroNet will not pop up in your browser like in Windows. You will have to manually paste or click on the **http://127.0.0.1:43110** link that you see printed for you in the _terminal_ to get to ZeroNet.

post.title: Change the Name of Sites to Recognise them
Protect yourself with a non-working proxy
post.body:
[Erkan](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroblog.bit/?Post:60:protect+yourselves:+set+a+non-working+proxy) highlights that ZeroNet can sometimes spill into the wider internet. To protect yourself from this accidently happening he advises that we use a non-working proxy. Having done this the [Archive.org](http://127.0.0.1:43110/18mvQ6gt9U5h5JuSY8LrttueyL6rdADjPp/) mirror links do not work: meaning that its links are being connected to outside of ZeroNet :|

I think it is because I used this tutorial: 

~~https://fosswire.com/post/2008/04/create-a-mirror-of-a-website-with-wget/~~

Rather than:

http://linuxreviews.org/quicktips/wget/

And so got a copy of the website that links to outside rather than a full offline copy:(

post.title: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python (ZeroNet mirror)
post.body:
[Automate the Boring Stuff](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HhZ7jSBKYCjd8yuCLKLBiAubETCB7uSi4/) is a website released under a Creative Commons license by the author who we thank very much. It recently had a problem with a back-up and went into maintenance. Even now the Trinket part (Chapter 2 onward) is not working. Because of this I saw the need to back it up myself using [wget](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:17:Publishing+Your+Own+ZeroNet+Website). 

What I've learnt is that the same thing happens to [Archive.org](http://127.0.0.1:43110/18mvQ6gt9U5h5JuSY8LrttueyL6rdADjPp) as [Automate the Boring Stuff](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HhZ7jSBKYCjd8yuCLKLBiAubETCB7uSi4/): you need to go top-left and click **'Home'** to get the full site on ZeroNet. Otherwise it's broken pages.

post.title: Just watched D.O.A on Archive.org mirror zite
post.body:
I was browsing on the [Archive.org mirror test zite](http://127.0.0.1:43110/18mvQ6gt9U5h5JuSY8LrttueyL6rdADjPp) when I came across an old black and white, 'D.O.A.' in the Films Noir section. A real classic. I am surprised the MP4 played in-browser on ZeroNet. 

To see it you'll need to use the top-right icons and find 'Video' then 'Movies': the rest of the links on the _Home page_ don't work:( 

The 'Movies' hyperlink takes a little time to load, but it eventually did for me.

post.title: Archive.org on Zeronet
post.body:
I recently found Disney's Alladin on Archive.org. I wanted to see what would happen if I **wget** that page and made it a new ZeroNet zite, whether I could still play the game. The [result is here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/18mvQ6gt9U5h5JuSY8LrttueyL6rdADjPp). Click the _Software_ icon, top-right, and navigate through to _MS-DOS games_. Some of the other links are not working as I only chose to **wget**, for offline use, the Alladin game's page. 

The Alladin game does not play nor do the others I tried.  I did lose internet someway through the download and as [tkarita](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:17:Publishing+Your+Own+ZeroNet+Website#Comments) points out, ZeroNet restricts some characters that **wget** doesn't. 

The instructions I used are found here:

https://fosswire.com/post/2008/04/create-a-mirror-of-a-website-with-wget/

**GNU** is Linux.

post.title: Publishing Your Own ZeroNet Website
post.body:
If you've [created your own ZeroNet website](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:13:Create+new+ZeroNet+Site+in+Windows+Operating+System) you would have got this at _command prompt_ (here $ is used to mean the Command Prompt):

**$ ZeroBundle-win\ZeroBundle>zeronet.cmd siteCreate
- Starting ZeroNet...
- OpenSSL loaded, version: 01000201F
- Generating new privatekey...
- ----------------------------------------------------------------------
- Site private key: **************************************************
-                   !!! ^ Save it now, required to modify the site ^ !!!
- Site address:     **************************************************
- ----------------------------------------------------------------------**
Where you see ************************ is where there'll be a lot of numbers and letters. The top one is your _private key_ and the second your _Site address_. 

You can search for your _Site address_ folder by searching on your computer for the file named the same as your _Site address_ and you'll find two files: (1) _content.json_ and (2) _index.html_

Let's say you have a favourite site on the _world wide web_ you want to share on ZeroNet. In a Linux terminal (I don't know about Windows) you can use:

_wget --wait=20 --limit-rate=20K -r -p -U Mozilla http://www.stupidsite.com/restricedplace.html_

(instructions are found here: http://linuxreviews.org/quicktips/wget/)

And replace **http://www.stupidsite.com/restricedplace.html_** with the website you want to share on ZeroNet. You'll get an **index.html** file once the process is finished downloading. Replace this in your _Site address_ folder (that is at (2) above). 

You'll then want to [publish this as a zite](http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/using_zeronet/create_new_site/). In Windows I had to use at _Command Prompt_ ($):

$ ZeroBundle-win\ZeroBundle>zeronet.cmd siteSign 1E48gDb4c2ZrTgQZfBdreMqGzVestrDg17

And then you'll be asked for your _private key_ which you saved when you created your new ZeroNet site. You'll copy and paste it, but the line will keep flickering and not move an inch. It is okay. Copy and paste once, then press ENTER on your keyboard. [Then share your zite by publicising your zite address](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Post:4:Publicise+your+Zero+Blog+to+New+0Net+Sites). 

[Here is my zite from the World Wide Web as proof](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1E48gDb4c2ZrTgQZfBdreMqGzVestrDg17).

post.title: ***in your blog*** is the same as Italics
post.body: A triple asterisk while editing your blog post gives you ***italics***.

post.title: Changing the Avatar on your ZeroNet Blog
post.body:
If you've already got yourself a ZeroNet blog you'll soon want to change the picture on the left to something more distinctive. What I've learned is that you can find your blog folder by looking at the web address above. My blog shows up as: 

_http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS/?Home_

and so my blog folder on my computer is called:

_1HBXiufU8RyFMREQa27yM92U329EXrfWvS_

I searched for that as I would any file or folder on my computer and found a folder called **img** which I assumed to mean 'images'. Inside was a file called **avatar**. I looked for a Creative Commons image for 'newbie'. Saved it. Then replaced it in that same **img** folder with the name **avatar**.

post.title: GitHub ZeroNet Linux installation instructions
post.body:
GitHub's instructions to install ZeroNet on Linux Operating Systems (_https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet#user-content-how-to-join_) gives the following to be inputted at the Linux terminal:

_wget https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroBundle/raw/master/dist/ZeroBundle-linux64.tar.gz
tar xvpfz ZeroBundle-linux64.tar.gz
cd ZeroBundle
Start with ./ZeroNet.sh_

Note that **ZeroBundle-linux64**.tar.gz is the 64bit version. If you have a 32bit machine you will need to replace that with ZeroBundle-linux**32**.tar.gz. It appears twice in the instructions so remember to change it twice if you are copying and pasting into the Linux terminal. 

I did this, but could not get ZeroNet to work. I don't yet know why:(

post.title: Create new ZeroNet Site in Windows Operating System
post.body:
I've tried to follow the instructions to [Create new ZeroNet site](http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/using_zeronet/create_new_site/) but in Windows I found I need to use the following at the _Command Prompt_ (indicated here by the $ sign):

$**ZeroBundle-win\ZeroBundle>zeronet.cmd siteCreate** 

and not what the instructions say: ~~"../Python/python.exe" zeronet.py siteCreate~~

If you don't know where the _Command Prompt_ is, just click the Windows button (bottom left of the screen) and in the search bar search 'cmd', 'command' or 'command prompt' and you'll see a blackscreen app with **C:\\_** written on it in white: click that.

post.title: Accepting 'Merge' on Vide0ramA will spam your ZeroNet
post.body: Vide0ramA is not on Kaffiene's search but once you find it you will be asked to accept a 'Merge'. I did, not knowing what this meant. Until my Zeronet was filled with all manner of clones of Vide0rama's main zite. It took a long time to delete them all: especially that 'delete' is a two step process.

post.title: Opening another Tab in my web browser for my cloned Snake Game
post.body: I [cloned the Snake Game](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CheBkHfMXfySd3Mfkr5et3RHZbTFDdydk/). When I tried to play it, it didn't work properly until I opened another Tab with the same mySnakeGame: it then began working with me alone as peer.

post.title: MaidSafe's Safe Network requires a script address added to Network Settings which does not work with ZeroNet
post.body: MaidSafe has a decentralised network. To work it requires software downloads and a change to the computer's _network settings_. However, once that _script address_ had been saved, ZeroNet would not connect through the internet. It was easy however to toggle the _script address_ off when required and get ZeroNet back online.

post.title: The Snake Game is cool
post.body: The [Snake Game](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CheBkHfMXfySd3Mfkr5et3RHZbTFDdydk/) works and is fun - well, it did the last time I played it:(

post.title: Seeding with a torrent client on ZeroTube
post.body: If you do get [ZeroTube](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FUQPLXHimgCvYHH7v3bJXspJ7bMBUXcEb) to work for you and find a peer seeding a video you can then watch, you may want to click the 'magnet' link and get your torrent client to download and seed the video. But this did not work for me - [now I know why](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_16w7UuJAHbt8YBa8zxHS7UFk9mq8Q5DpE4/KOPY+KATE+YouTube+Alternative+Browser+Torrent+Streaming).

post.title: Zerotube works but not with some browsers
post.body: [Zerotube](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FUQPLXHimgCvYHH7v3bJXspJ7bMBUXcEb) works and will play the uploaded videos. It doesn't work with web browsers that don't support _'webrtc'_ and to their credit they are very open about it. I got Zerotube to work with firefox but not Microsoft Edge or the tor browser. Some other zites like [Vide0ramA](http://127.0.0.1:43110/18SZadPsFtTEefBK5CTvRSFiBXs9TvAGEG/) and [Zerotube 0.1](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1H4UUf34qjiiaZhPatnvfBA32dbWEeRQW3) won't tell you and will leave you hanging.

post.title: An error message appears when I try to link to a /data.txt page
post.body: If you go to [Kaffiene's Search](http://127.0.0.1:43110/kaffiene.bit/) and click the '1183 sites' link you'll be sent to a /data.txt page. But I could not link to this on the below blog.

post.title: To find zites without knowing what you are looking for Ctrl-F Kaffiene's Data page
post.body: You may be wondering what other zites there are on ZeroNet. You can find some of them by going to [Kaffiene Search and clicking the '1183 sites' link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/kaffiene.bit/).

post.title: Publicise your Zero Blog to New 0Net Sites
post.body:
You can then publicise your new zite to [New 0net Sites](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n/) here. Remember to remove the last **/** so that the web address can be recognised.

Also on [0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/).

post.title: To add links in your blog
post.body: To add links to your blog, press the '?' button at the bottom right near the 'Save' button and it will give you this description: **[Links] (http://www.zeronet.io)**, which you copy (without the space between [links] and the (http://www.zeronet.io), changing the words to those of your description and blog web address.

post.title: How to create your own blog
post.body: Here is a [short animated tutorial](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Ajp75FXAxdTzRiRTpdBgd4exvbo4gMW12/?Post:4:How+to+Create+a+Blog+%28Animation%29) about creating your own blog.

post.title: Posting things on myZeroBlog
post.body: Every edit I make on myZeroBlog requires the **'Save'** button on the bottom right of the screen to be pressed for that edit to be made.
